snippet: Sales of the Sunday edition of The Sun, a brash daily tabloid, have fallen 28 percent since it first hit newsstands in February.
abstract: Sales of Rupert Murdoch's Sunday edition of The Sun, a brash daily tabloid, have fallen 28 percent since it launched in February from 3.2 million to 2.3 million readers in April; paper was intended to fill the void left by the closed News of the World.
lead_paragraph: Sales of the Sunday edition of The Sun, a brash daily tabloid, have fallen 28 percent since it first hit newsstands in February.

headline.seo: Sales Slip for The Sun on Sunday in Britain, Murdoch’s New Paper
headline.main: New Tabloid by Murdoch Losing Sales
headline.print_headline: New Tabloid By Murdoch Losing Sales
